item.title: Cell culture tips
item.description: As my postdoc / mentor likes to say, Trust no one. (only applies to cell culture, not to life in general)

item.title: Efficient genome editing in the mouse brain by local delivery of engineered Cas9 RNP complexes
item.description: Link to paper Summary The study demonstrates efficient genome editing in post-mitotic neurons of the adult mouse brain using Cas9 ribonucleoprotein (RNP) complexes -> holds promise for correcting/inactivating genetic causes of neurological diseases characterized by specific neuronal populations via safe Cas9 delivery with minimal immune response Engineered Cas9 variants with multiple SV40 nuclear localization sequences (NLS) enhance the efficiency of neuronal genome editing in vivo by 10x, addressing the challenge of tissue-specific delivery Mouse model Ai9 tdTomato is used to detect Cas9 editing, providing a quantitative method for genome modification.

item.title: Flow Cytometry
item.description: Helpful animated video Takeaways from video Flow cytometry is an experimental technique used to count and analyze individual cells within a mixed population based on their size, shape, and other properties.
